00085   template <typename TImageContainer>
00086   struct VolReader
00087   {
00088     // ----------------------- Standard services ------------------------------

00102     static ImageContainer importVol(const std::string & filename) throw(DGtal::IOException);

00105   private:
00106 
00107     typedef unsigned char voxel;
00108     // This class help us to associate a field type and his value.
00109     // An object is a pair (type, value). You can copy and assign
00110     // such objects.
00111     /* In recent C++, we should use a std::map, but we prefer (badly) code it
00112        by hand for compatibility with old compilers.
00113        At this time, there is a limit of 30 fields in header :-} */
00114     struct HeaderField {
00116       HeaderField( const char *t, const char *v ) :
00117         type( strdup(t) ), value( strdup(v) ) {}
00118       ~HeaderField() {
00119         free( type );
00120         free( value );
00121       }
00123       HeaderField( const HeaderField &h ) :
00124         type( strdup(h.type) ), value( strdup(h.value) ) {};
00126       HeaderField() : type(NULL), value(NULL) {};
00128       const HeaderField &operator = (const HeaderField &h) {
00129         free( type );
00130         free( value );
00131         if (h.type != NULL) {
00132           type = strdup( h.type );
00133           value = strdup( h.value );
00134         }
00135         return *this;
00136       }
00138       char *type;
00140       char *value;
00141     };
00142 
00143 
00145     static const char *getHeaderValue( const char *type, const HeaderField * header );
00146 
00148     static     int getHeaderValueAsInt( const char *type, int *dest , const HeaderField * header);
00149 
00150 
00152     static const int MAX_HEADERNUMLINES = 64;
00153     
00154     
00156     static int getHeaderField( const char *type, const HeaderField * header ) ;
00157     
00159     static const char *requiredHeaders[];
00160    
00161   }; // end of class VolReader
